body:
Dear *|nickname|*, 
We have now reviewed your Contract of Sale. Our feedback can be accessed via [My documents] (*|url|*) . 
The Contract of Sale is the most important document in the conveyancing process as it records the terms of your agreement with the seller. 
If you are happy to proceed, please organise to sign the contract with your real estate agent. 
What happens next? 
Your real estate agent will organise the seller to countersign the contract. 
Once all parties have signed the Contract of Sale, it is your responsibility to ensure we receive a signed copy which should be electronically uploaded to the Startup Inc platform. 
You may also find the [Startup Inc Buyer’s Guide] (*|url|*) a useful reference tool. 
If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us on 1800-STARTUP. We are here to help.
name: contract-upload

body:
Dear *|nickname|*, 
We have now reviewed your Contract of Sale. Our feedback can be accessed via [My documents] (*|url|*) . 
The Contract of Sale is the most important document in the conveyancing process as it records the terms of your agreement with the seller. 
If you are happy to proceed, please organise to sign the contract with the selling agent. 
What happens next? 
The selling agent will organise the seller to countersign the contract. 
Once all parties have signed the Contract of Sale, it is your responsibility to ensure we receive a signed copy which should be electronically uploaded to the Startup Inc platform. 
You may also find the [Startup Inc Buyer’s Guide] (*|url|*) a useful reference tool. 
If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us on 1800-STARTUP. We are here to help.
name: contract-upload-otp

body:
Dear *|nickname|*,

If you are happy to proceed, please organise to sign the contract with the selling agent. 
What happens next? 
The selling agent will organise the seller to countersign the contract. 
Once all parties have signed the Contract of Sale, it is your responsibility to ensure we receive a signed copy which should be electronically uploaded to the Startup Inc platform. 
You may also find the [Startup Inc Buyer’s Guide] (*|url|*) a useful reference tool.

If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us on 1800-STARTUP—we are here to help.

body:
Dear *|nickname|*, 
Thanks! We received everything we asked from you. 
A copy of your marketing Contract of Sale can be reviewed in [My documents] (*|url|*) . 
At this stage, we only need you to review the marketing contract and advise us if you require any amendments. 
Otherwise, we will forward a copy directly to the real estate agent. 
What happens next? 
It’s important that you are 100% happy with the buyer’s offer. Please DO NOT sign the Contract of Sale until the buyer has made you a formal offer that you are happy with. You will be legally bound as soon as you sign, date and exchange the Contract of Sale. 
If you think you may require the deposit to be released before settlement, please let us know as soon as possible so we can assess your eligibility and get things started. 
If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us on 1800-STARTUP. We are here to help.
name: draft-contract-nsw-selling

body:
Dear *|nickname|*, 
Thanks! We received everything we asked from you. 
A draft copy of your Contract of Sale and Section 32 Vendor’s Statement can be reviewed in [My documents] (*|url|*) . 
Please read these carefully and if you require any amendments, let us know as soon as possible. 
At this stage, we only need you to sign and electronically upload the Section 32 Vendor’s Statement so we can finalise this document and forward it to your real estate agent. 
What happens next? 
Please DO NOT sign the Contract of Sale until the buyer has made you a formal offer in writing and signed this document. 
It’s important that you are 100% happy with the buyer’s offer. You will be legally bound as soon as you sign and date the Contract of Sale. 
If you think you may require the deposit to be released before settlement, please let us know as soon as possible so we can assess your eligibility and get things started. 
If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us on 1800-STARTUP. We are here to help.
name: draft-contract-seller

body:
Dear *|nickname|*, 
Please change your password by clicking [here.] (*|url|*)
name: convx-forgotpassword

body:
Dear *|nickname|*, 
Congratulations on your purchase! We have now received the signed Contract of Sale. Please read through our [Startup Inc Letter of Engagement] (*|url|*) as it contains some very important information. 
The following items in [My documents] (*|url|*) require your immediate attention: 
  *  read and sign our Client Authorisation Form   *  complete and submit our Startup Inc Buyer’s Questionnaire   *  review our Startup Inc Costs Disclosure. 
What happens next? 
You must ensure that you have paid the deposit on your purchase by the due date as outlined in your Contract of Sale. 
If the Contract of Sale is subject to any special conditions, it is your responsibility these are met by the agreed deadline. 
If you cannot meet deadlines on any special conditions, you must let us know so we can communicate this information to all parties before you are legally bound by the Contract of Sale. 
If you need help with any of the above, please contact us on 1800-STARTUP. We are here to help.
name: initial-engagement-buying

body:
Dear *|nickname|*, 
Congratulations on your off the plan purchase! We have now received the signed Contract of Sale. Please read through our [Startup Inc Letter of Engagement] (*|url|*) as it contains some very important information. 
The following items in [My documents] (*|url|*) require your immediate attention: 
  *  read and sign our Client Authorisation Form   *  review our Startup Inc Costs Disclosure. 
The Contract of Sale is the most important document in the conveyancing process as it records the terms of your agreement with the seller in writing. Do not rely upon any oral terms or undertakings given to you by the seller and/or agents. 
The property is being sold to you off the plan, which means the developer/seller is yet to complete construction of the property as at the date of sale. 
We will let you know when we receive notification that the development has been completed. At this time, it is vital that you contact your lender/bank (if applicable) to arrange for signing of the loan documents. Do not delay this important step as it could impact your settlement. 
You might also: 
  *  incur penalty interest   *  be liable for damages/losses. 
What happens next? 
You must let us know, if you cannot meet deadlines on any special conditions so we can communicate this information to all parties before you are bound by the Contract of Sale. 
If you need help with any of the above, please contact us on 1800-STARTUP. We are here to help.
name: initial-engagement-otp

body:
Dear *|nickname|*, 
We have received your instructions–thank you. 
We have just uploaded our [Startup Inc Letter of Engagement] (*|url|*) which highlights some very important information. 
The following items in [My documents] (*|url|*) require your immediate attention: 
  *  read and sign our Client Authorisation Form   *  complete and submit our Startup Inc Seller’s Questionnaire   *  review our Startup Inc Costs Disclosure. 
The Contract of Sale is an essential document in the conveyancing process as it records the terms of your agreement with the purchaser. 
A current Section 32 Vendor’s Statement is also very important, as this must be provided to the buyer before they sign the Contract of Sale. It contains all the important information about the property you are selling. 
We will draft these documents as soon as we receive everything we need from you. 
You may also find the [Startup Inc Seller’s Guide] (*|url|*) a useful resource. 
If you need help with any of the above, please contact us on 1800-STARTUP. We are here to help.
name: initial-engagement-selling

body:
Dear *|nickname|*, 
Great news! We have been notified that the plan of subdivision for *|address|* is now registered. 
Settlement is expected to take place on *|settlement_date|* 
The following items in [My documents] (*|url|*) require your immediate attention: 
  *  complete and review our Startup Inc Off The Plan Buyer’s Questionnaire   *  verify your identity (VOI). 
Please also review and approve the following documents within 14 days: 
  *  the registered plan   *  the certificate of occupancy. 
Please contact your Startup Inc conveyancer immediately if you have any concerns about these documents. 
What happens next? 
Finance 
If you haven’t already, please don’t forget to let us know who your bank/lender is so we can invite them to settlement. 
If you are not applying for finance, we will let you know how much you will be required to pay at settlement. 
Please do not hesitate to contact us on 1800-STARTUP, if you have any questions. We are here to help.
name: occupancy-otp

body:
Dear *|nickname|*, 
Congratulations! The settlement of your purchase is now complete, and you are now the registered owner. 
The document that records who owns the property is called an eCT (electronic Certificate of Title). If there is a mortgage on your property, your bank/lender will be the electronic controller of your eCT until the loan is repaid. 
If there is no mortgage on your property, Startup Inc will be the electronic controller of your eCT unless we are instructed otherwise. 
Startup Inc will now notify council and water authorities that you are the new owner. 
It is your responsibility to ensure that your other utility providers have now been notified. 
Should you require a copy of the adjustments and settlement statement or Startup Inc tax invoice, these can be accessed via [My documents] (*|url|*) . We recommend you download and save these for future reference. 
Thanks for your business and please don’t hesitate to contact us if we can help with anything else down the track.
name: settlement-complete-buyer

body:
Dear *|nickname|*, 
Congratulations! The settlement of your new property is now complete, and you are now the registered owner. 
The document that records who owns the property is called an eCT (electronic Certificate of Title). If there is a mortgage on your property, your bank/lender will be the electronic controller of your eCT until the loan is repaid. 
If there is no mortgage on your property, Startup Inc will be the electronic controller of your eCT unless we are instructed otherwise. 
Startup Inc will now notify council and water authorities that you are the new owner. 
It is your responsibility to arrange the connection of utilities in your name. 
Should you require a copy of the registered plan, certificate of occupancy, adjustments, settlement statement or Startup Inc tax invoice, these can be accessed via [My documents] (*|url|*) . We recommend you download and save these for future reference. 
Thanks for your business and please don’t hesitate to contact us if we can help with anything else down the track.
name: settlement-complete-otp

body:
Dear *|nickname|*, 
Congratulations! The settlement of your sale is complete. 
Startup Inc will now notify council and water authorities that you no longer own the property. 
It is your responsibility to close the accounts of your remaining utility providers. 
Should you require a copy of the adjustments and settlement statement or Startup Inc tax invoice, these can be accessed via [My documents] (*|url|*) . 
We recommend you also download and save these documents for future reference. 
Thanks for your business and please don’t hesitate to contact us if we can help with anything down the track.
name: settlement-complete-seller

body:
Dear *|nickname|*, 
It’s time to prepare for settlement, but before this happens, we need a few things from you. 
  *  You will receive an email from the State Revenue Office. It is important you follow the link in that email 
to review and approve the information we have provided. Settlement will not proceed until you complete 
this step.   *  Please check [My documents] (*|url|*) for the following information and contact us if you have any questions or 
concerns: 
  * funds required for settlement   * adjustments and settlement statement   * Startup Inc tax invoice 
Final inspection 
As a buyer, you are entitled to undertake a final inspection in the week before settlement. The purpose of this is to ensure that the property is in the same condition as when it was initially inspected by you. 
It’s a good idea to conduct this inspection as close to settlement as possible. Things look a lot different without furniture! 
You’ll save yourself a lot of stress if you test electrical devices such as garage roller doors, air conditioning/heating units, pool equipment, central vacuuming systems, security and the stove! And don’t forget to ask the real estate agent for user manuals. 
You can do this inspection with the real estate agent or the seller. 
Finally, we encourage you to revisit the [Startup Inc Buyer’s Guide] (*|url|*) . 
Ask yourself, is your new property insured, have you connected your utilities, redirected your mail and arranged for the collection of your keys? Does your bank have everything they need to proceed to settlement? 
If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us on 1800-STARTUP. We are here to help.
name: settlement-details-buyer

body:
Dear *|nickname|*, 
It’s time to prepare for settlement, but before this happens, we need a few things from you. 
  *  You will receive an email from the State Revenue Office. It is important you follow the link in that email to review and approve the information we have provided. Settlement will not proceed until you complete this step.   *  Please check [My documents] (*|url|*) for the following information and contact us if you have any questions or 
concerns: 
  * funds required for settlement   * adjustments and settlement statement   * Startup Inc tax invoice 
Final inspection 
As a buyer, you are entitled to undertake one final inspection in the week before settlement. The purpose of this is to ensure that the property is in the condition as agreed in the Contract of Sale. 
It’s a good idea to conduct this inspection as close to settlement as possible. 
You can arrange this inspection with the selling agent or the seller. 
Finally, we encourage you to revisit the [Startup Inc Off The Plan Buyer’s Guide] (*|url|*) . 
Ask yourself, have you connected your utilities, redirected your mail and arranged for the collection of your key or handover pack? Does your bank have everything they need to proceed to settlement? 
Have you arranged for contents insurance and, if the property is to be tenanted, have you arranged for landlord’s insurance? 
If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us on 1800-STARTUP. We are here to help.
name: settlement-details-otp

body:
Dear *|nickname|*, 
It’s time to prepare for settlement, but before this happens, we need a few things from you. 
  *  You will receive an email from the State Revenue Office. It is important you follow the link in that email 
to review and approve the information we have provided. Settlement will not proceed until you complete 
this step.   *  Please check [My documents] (*|url|*) for the following information and contact us if you have any questions or 
concerns: 
  * funds required for settlement   * adjustments and settlement statement   * real estate statement of account   * Startup Inc tax invoice 
Reminders 
The buyer is entitled to undertake a final inspection of the property in the week before settlement. The purpose of this is to ensure that the property is in the same condition as when it was initially inspected by them. 
We encourage you to revisit the [Startup Inc Seller’s Guide] (*|url|*) - there is a lot to remember. 
Have you: 
  * arranged for the disconnection of all utilities   * organised mail redirection   * contacted your insurer to cancel your policy post-settlement   * cleared the property   * left full sets of keys and user manuals for the real estate agent to release at settlement. 
If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us on 1800-STARTUP. We are here to help.
name: settlement-details-seller

body:
Dear *|nickname|*, 
Thanks! We received everything we asked from you. 
Please note, if any of your personal circumstances have changed since you first completed our Startup Inc 
Buyer’s Questionnaire, it’s important that you let us know as soon as possible as this can directly affect your settlement and the ownership of your property. 
What happens next? 
Property enquiries 
We will now conduct property searches and enquiries to double check the information in the Contract of Sale and Section 32 Vendor’s Statement is correct. 
Finance 
If you are borrowing money to purchase the property, you must now let your bank/lender know that you have signed a Contract of Sale. 
If you haven’t already, please don’t forget to let us know who your bank/lender is so we can invite them to settlement. 
If you are not applying for finance, we will let you know how much you will be required to pay at settlement. 
If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us on 1800-STARTUP. We are here to help.
name: settlement-preparation-buyer

body:
Dear *|nickname|*, 
Congratulations on the sale of your property! 
Although the property has now been sold, it is still yours until settlement. That’s why, for your own protection, we strongly recommend you remain fully insured right up until settlement. 
It’s important to note that under your contract, your property must remain in the same condition as when the buyer first inspected the property. 
Discharge of Mortgage 
If you have a mortgage on your property, Startup Inc will now: 
  * ask you to sign a mortgage discharge authority   * ask your bank/lender to prepare for settlement   * ask your bank/lender for the final payout figure. 
If you don’t have a mortgage on your property, you don’t have to do anything else right now. 
If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us on 1800-STARTUP. We are here to help.
name: settlement-preparation-seller

body:
Dear *|nickname|*,
Thank you for taking the time to tell us more about yourself during your recent online interview.
Congratulations! We are delighted to invite you to join the Startup Inc community.
Please review and accept the independent contractor agreement and then [click here to complete your registration process] (*|url|*) .
If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us on 1800-STARTUP— we are here to help.
